{{cpp/title|has_facet}}
{{cpp/locale/navbar}}
{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl header|locale}}
{{dcl rev multi|until1=c++11
|dcl1=
template&lt; class Facet &gt;
bool has_facet( const locale&amp; loc ) throw();
|dcl2=
template&lt; class Facet &gt;
bool has_facet( const locale&amp; loc ) noexcept;
}}
{{dcl end}}

Checks if the locale {{c|loc}} implements the facet {{tt|Facet}}.

The program is ill-formed if Facet is not a {{rlp|locale/facet#Facet class|facet}} or it is a volatile-qualified facet.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|loc|the locale object to query}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
Returns {{c|true}} if the facet {{tt|Facet}} was installed in the locale {{c|loc}}, {{c|false}} otherwise.

===Notes===
{{tt|std::has_facet}} must return {{c|true}} for all locales {{c|loc}} if {{tt|Facet}} is one of the standard facets given {{rlp|locale|here}}.

===Example===
{{example
|
|code=
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;locale&gt;

// minimal custom facet
struct myfacet : public std::locale::facet
{
    static std::locale::id id;
};

std::locale::id myfacet::id;

int main()
{
    // loc is a "C" locale with myfacet added
    std::locale loc(std::locale::classic(), new myfacet);
    std::cout &lt;&lt; std::boolalpha
              &lt;&lt; "Can loc classify chars? "
              &lt;&lt; std::has_facet&lt;std::ctype&lt;char&gt;&gt;(loc) &lt;&lt; '\n'
              &lt;&lt; "Can loc classify char32_t? "
              &lt;&lt; std::has_facet&lt;std::ctype&lt;char32_t&gt;&gt;(loc) &lt;&lt; '\n'
              &lt;&lt; "Does loc implement myfacet? "
              &lt;&lt; std::has_facet&lt;myfacet&gt;(loc) &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|output=
Can loc classify chars? true
Can loc classify char32_t? false
Does loc implement myfacet? true
}}
